summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorney Maurene and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The communication confirms receipt and discusses confidentiality of the request.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Jocks
persons.context: Attorney at Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC who received and confirmed receipt of a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sent a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Both named together as subjects of a subpoena seeking information from Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Correspondence regarding legal subpoena between Assistant U.S. Attorney and attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts in February 2020 seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The subpoena request was kept confidential as confirmed in correspondence between the prosecutor and the attorney representing Interlochen.
The document shows ongoing investigation activities related to Epstein and Maxwell in early 2020, after Epstein's death.
Interlochen Center for the Arts appears to have information relevant to the Epstein-Maxwell investigation that prosecutors sought through legal process.
